results.title: A Total Lunar Eclipse in Early Tuesday Skies
results.abstract: Those who woke up early to head to the polls on Tuesday, got a shot at seeing the moon darken as it fell into Earth’s shadow.

results.title: $2 Billion Powerball Ticket Sold in Los Angeles County, Lottery Officials Said
results.abstract: The identity of the winner or winners is not yet known, but the California Lottery said it had made its first billionaire. There was a delay in announcing the winning numbers, because of a security issue.

media.caption: The Powerball jackpot grew to $1.9 billion after the drawing Saturday night produced no top prize winner.

results.title: New Endorsements for College Athletes Resurface an Old Concern: Sex Sells
results.abstract: Female college athletes are making millions thanks to their large social media followings. But some who have fought for equity in women’s sports worry that their brand building is regressive.

media.caption: Olivia Dunne, a gymnast at Louisiana State, earns over $1 million annually in endorsements. “That is something I’m proud of,” she said, adding that most female athletes will not advance to a pro league after college.
media.copyright: Annie Flanagan for The New York Times

results.title: Tropical Storm Nicole to Become a Hurricane as It Churns Toward Florida
results.abstract: Hurricane warnings were in effect early Wednesday for the northwestern Bahamas and a stretch of Florida’s east coast.

results.abstract: Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, said it had reached a deal to buy FTX, amid fears the industry could enter another meltdown.

results.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Is Re-Elected and Poised for More Power in G.O.P.
results.abstract: The Georgia Republican’s racist and antisemitic conspiracy theories put her on the party’s fringes, but she is likely to play a more central role in the next Congress.

results.title: Evelyn de Rothschild, Scion of Banking Dynasty, Dies at 91
results.abstract: Initially showing little promise, he eventually joined the family firm and rose to chairman, wielding vast influence in Britain’s financial and political affairs.

media.caption: Evelyn de Rothschild in 1968. He mastered the intricacies of a boutique bank trying to survive in a globalized world of financial institutions. He was a financial adviser to Queen Elizabeth II.
